attributes.title: Physical stock verification.
attributes.description:
Physical stock was verified on 10.03.2025.

The table below shows the summary of the stock findings

·           The following were the stock findings;

ü  Bread -     -86 loaves

ü  Cumulative variance in polybags was -133 pieces

All other materials had negligible variances.
attributes.recommendation: ·       The management to ensure that the set stock controls are consistently adhered to avoid stock variances.

value: · More improvement measures will be initiated.
·     Control is ok and will maintain the trend.
+ February audit report highlighted minimal item variations for stock verified on 07.02.25.
Previous

+ A stock take exercise was conducted on 10.03.25 to assess the effectiveness of internal controls that are put in place to safeguard company assets such as the production materials and the finished products.
+ Minimal variances noted in stock items is an indication that stock controls are being observed.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring strong internal controls.

attributes.title: Dough weight analysis
attributes.description:
+ Dough weights were sampled on 10.03.25 (during 2ndhift)

Dough weights sampled on 10.03.2025:(2 shift @7.00pm)
attributes.recommendation: + Adherence to set dough dividing weights ensures standard bread weight production.

value: + Dough weights were within the allowed range and this will be maintained.
+ We will always sensitize dough dividers to adhere to stipulated dough dividing weights. Few dough weight extremes noted will be addressed.
+ Dough weights were sampled to check compliance.
+ Adherence to set dough weights checks under and overweight bread production.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring adherence to set standard dough weights.

attributes.title: Packed bread weight analysis
attributes.description: ·         Bread weights were sampled on 10/03/2025 and the following below were the results.
attributes.recommendation: + Overweight bread rate for 600CT white bread was 26.67% which was higher than the allowable 10%. This should be addressed to ensure standard bread weight production.

value: + Noted overweight bread will be addressed.
+ We will follow up on the overweight issue and address the same in near future.
+ February 2025 audit report highlighted high overweight bread rate for packed bread weighed on 07.02.2025.
Previous
+ Sample varieties of packed bread were randomly picked and weighed to establish whether the branch adheres to weights and measures standards.
+ Overweight bread lowers yield targets hence withholding revenues.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring standard bread weight production.

attributes.title: Bread damages (production and market) analysis
attributes.description:
·          Both market and production damages were analyzed from 01/02/2025 - 28/02/2025.

+ high production damage rate was noted with 324loaves being lost as a result.

PRODUCTION DAMAGE ANALYSIS:

·          Production damage rate is tabulated below.

MARKET DAMAGE ANALYSIS:

·          Market damage rate is tabulated below.
attributes.recommendation:
·          Proper baking processes will ensure that damages are fully checked.

·          The management should focus on efforts to address high production damages to ensure that the company doesn’t lose revenues.

value: + We will put more efforts to address noted high production damages.
+ Noted high production damages will be addressed.
+ February 2025 audit report highlighted high production damages as analyzed from 01/01/25 – 31/01/25.
Previous

+ The test was conducted to determine the extent of damages produced during production and those replaced as market damages and find out if they were within expected/set limits. High damages suggest bread of inferior quality produced.
+ High production damages implies that the company is exposed to losses and revenue targets were not realized.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring controlled bread damages. that is bread damages are managed within the allowable rate.

attributes.title: Raw materials consumption quantities.
attributes.description:
·          Comparison of manual mixing charts and the system mixing charts was done from 01.02.25 – 28.02.25 to find out if accurate transfer of production data was being done.

Below are the summary of the findings

·          The above table shows that;

·          There was no significant variance between system and the actual material consumption.

·          Correct posting was also noted over the audited period.
attributes.recommendation: + The branch should continue observing the set consumption and production standards.

value: ·           This is noted and will be maintained.
+ We will always ensure that actual production is reflected on production records/registers,
+ February 2025 audit report highlighted that raw material consumption quantities matched between mixing charts records and SAP system. This was analyzed during the month of January 2025 (01-31)
Previous
+ Comparison of manual mixing charts and the system mixing charts was done to find out if accurate transfer of production data was being done.
+ Consumption and production set standards were observed and this implies proper accountability of raw materials and finished goods.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring that actual raw material consumption is as per the set standards (BOM).

attributes.title: Physical cash verification.

·           Physical cash was verified on 10/03/2025, and below is a tabular analysis of the same.

attributes.recommendation: ·          Observed cash control is commendable.

value: + Proper cash control will be maintained.
+ We will always ensure that cash controls at the branch are strengthened.
+ Cash count on 07.02.25 showed minimal variations.
Previous
·           A spot check was done on cash office to verify if the company petty cash was well maintained.
+ Minimal cash variance suggests minimal cash loss risk and effective controls were put in place.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring cash control SOPs are adhered to.

attributes.title: Mini shop spot check.

attributes.recommendation: + The Mini shop attendant should keep up with the observed good stock and cash control.

value: + We shall maintain control at the mini shop.

attributes.title: Bread yields analysis
attributes.description:
+ SAP/BOM yields were compared to mixing chart summary yields variety wise during the period ranging 01.02.25 - 28.02.25.

+ Registers were matching for individual resulting bread yields.
attributes.recommendation: + Matching of yields is commendable and encouraged.

value: + We always ensure that desired yields are realized.
+ Set BOM yields will always be adhered to.
+ February 2025 audit report highlighted that expected yields were realized as analyzed from 01.01.25 - 31.01.25.
Previous
+ Mixing chart yields were analyzed and compared to SAP yields and assess if there were variances.
+ Adherence to set yields implied revenue targets were realized.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring adherence to BOM yields.

attributes.title: Production efficiency analysis.
attributes.description:
+ Analysis was done from 01/02/2025 - 28/02/2025.

+ Production inefficiency was noted with 48production staff being hired more than required.

·          Production efficiency is tabulated below;
attributes.recommendation:
·          The branch management should address production inefficiency noted.

·          Branch management should ensure observed proper planning is maintained.

·          Surplus costs incurred from production inefficiency should be surcharged.

value: + Production efficiencies are now monitored daily to ensure compliance.
+ I have introduced a system to track operational efficiencies with exceptions being flagged and addressed real time.
+ February 2025 audit report highlighted production inefficiency as analyzed from 01/01/25 – 31/01/25.
Previous

·          This test was conducted to determine if set production and packing efficiency was adhered to. Low efficiency would indicate increased production costs.

Standard production efficiency is 4.5bags/staff.
+ Production  inefficiency noted increased production costs. In this case production costs were increased by Kshs. 52,156.80.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring adherence to set production efficiency standards.

attributes.title: Packing efficiency analysis.
attributes.description:
+ Packing efficiency was analyzed from 01.02.25 - 28.02.25.

+ packing inefficiency was noted and 8packers were hired in excess.

·          Packing efficiency (01/02/2025 – 28/02/25) is tabulated below;
attributes.recommendation:
+ Packing inefficiency noted should be addressed.

+ surplus costs incurred from packing inefficiency should be recovered.

value:
+ Noted packing inefficiency has already been addressed.

+ During the time of audit average packing efficiency for the month was 97.5crates/packer.

+ We have already addressed packing inefficiency during the month of march 2025.

+ i have introduced a system to track daily packing efficiency to ensure that inefficiency is addressed.
+ February 2025 audit  highlighted that packing efficiency set was realized during the period ranging 01.01.25 - 31.01.25.
Previous
·          This test was conducted to determine if set  packing efficiency was adhered to. Low efficiency would indicate increased production costs.
+ Packing inefficiency increased production costs by Kshs. 7,296.00.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring realization of set packing efficiency.

attributes.title: Vehicle mileage and fuel consumption analysis.
attributes.description: + All sales vans had set fuel consumption rate as analyzed for the month of February 2025.

value: + All vehicles have set consumption rate.

Transport/Fleet Department
Ensuring all sales vans have set fuel standard consumption.

attributes.title: Motor vehicle mileage and fuel consumption analysis.
attributes.description:
+ Fuel consumption was determined for all sales vans during February 2025.

+ Findings of sales van fuel consumption show that fuel consumption was within the expected range.

MOTOR VEHICLE FUEL CONSUMPTION.

value: + Daily monitoring of vans is always ensured to observe fuel consumption set policies.
·          We will maintain the observed trend.

+ Ensuring adherence to set fuel consumption standard for all sales vans.
